query: Why is it important for the sides of the fuselage to be sloped (tumbled home)?
gold_answer: The sides of the fuselage are sloped to create a conical section when the fuselage is formed.
predict: Sloping (tumbling home) the sides ensures that the fuselage section is conical when formed from panel parts rather than cylindrical. This results in proper fitment with flat-top longerons and avoids bowing of the sides during assembly, which can lead to a banana-shaped box section. Without this sloped design, the shape would not match what's needed for the completed fuselage structure.
